main event: On March 14, 1950, an observer reported seeing an unidentified aerial object in Piggott, Arkansas.
interesting points: The object was described as being larger than it was wide, resembling a 100-pound sack of potatoes., The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes., The object was observed drifting from west to east at an altitude of around 5,000 feet., The observer noted that the object made no sound and had a bright, high brilliance., The witness stated that there were no clouds in the clear sky at the time of the observation.
witness description: The observer was standing in front of a service station at the time of the sighting, and was described as a reliable person with an excellent reputation in the community.
